overview: Both a photographic essay and critical text, Reconstructing a Public Sphere is New Yorkâ€“based artist John Miller's (born 1954) most autobiographical work to date, in which he uses Microsoft Powerpoint to ponder the civic history of Battery Park through a personal narrative of his experience of 9/11 (Artbook D.A.P and Alex Kitnick on the book Reconstructing a Public Sphere).
title: Reconstructing a Public Sphere
